stateCompliance.headline: Understanding Cash Advance Laws in Hialeah, Florida
stateCompliance.content: Residents of Hialeah are protected by Florida's comprehensive payday lending regulations, administered by the Florida Office of Financial Regulation's Division of Consumer Finance. Florida has some of the strongest consumer protection laws in the nation for payday loans, officially called 'Deferred Presentment Transactions' under Florida law.
keyPoints: All payday lenders in Hialeah must be licensed by the Florida Office of Financial Regulation
You can only have one payday loan at a time in Florida, enforced by statewide database
Single-payment loans are capped at $500 with maximum 10% fee plus $5 verification fee
Installment loans are capped at $1,000 with maximum 8% biweekly fee on outstanding balance
You must wait 24 hours after paying off one loan before taking out another
Loan rollovers and extensions are prohibited by law
If you can't pay on time, you're entitled to a 60-day grace period with free credit counseling
You cannot be criminally prosecuted for an unpaid payday loan
Prepayment penalties are prohibited - you can pay off early without extra cost
stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is provided for general educational purposes only and should not be construed as legal or financial advice. Payday loan laws and regulations are subject to change. For the most accurate and up-to-date information about Florida payday loan regulations, please contact the Florida Office of Financial Regulation at (850) 487-9687 or visit flofr.gov. Consult with a licensed financial advisor or attorney regarding your specific situation before making borrowing decisions.

nearbyLocations.intro: Can't make it to our Hialeah location? We also serve these nearby cities:

faq.question: Where is your Hialeah cash advance location?
faq.answer: Our Hialeah branch is located at 345 West 21st Street, Suite 110, right near Hialeah Park and Amelia Earhart Park. We're easily accessible from I-75 Exit 179.

faq.question: What are your hours at the Hialeah location?
faq.answer: We're open Monday through Friday from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM, and Saturday 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM. We're closed on Sundays. No appointment needed - walk-ins welcome!

faq.question: Do you serve Spanish-speaking customers?
faq.answer: Yes! Our Hialeah location has bilingual staff available to assist Spanish-speaking customers. We understand the community we serve.

faq.question: How much can I borrow in Hialeah?
faq.answer: Single-payment loans are capped at $500, and installment loans go up to $1,000 under Florida law. The actual amount depends on your income and ability to repay.

faq.question: What documents do I need to bring?
faq.answer: Bring a valid government-issued ID, proof of income (recent paystub or bank statement), and information about your checking account. Our staff will help walk you through the application.
